Git is like a save system for your code! To upload your Android project to GitHub:

1ï¸âƒ£ Create a repo on GitHub.
2ï¸âƒ£ Open Android Studio terminal (or Git app).
3ï¸âƒ£ Run:
   git init
   git remote add origin <your-repo-url>
   git add .
   git commit -m "Initial commit"
   git push -u origin master

OR ğŸ“± Use the GitHub Android app to create repo, then upload zipped project manually.

Linguin tip: Don't forget your `.gitignore` to avoid uploading build folders! ğŸ§

trigger: what is used in the virtual pet app
reply:
Here's the tech behind your awesome AI pet app ğŸ§:

âœ… **MVVM Architecture** â€” Clean separation of logic & UI
âœ… **Room Database** â€” To store items and pet stats locally
âœ… **Retrofit** â€” For API calls (OpenAI / alternatives)
âœ… **ViewModel + LiveData** â€” To observe and update pet state
âœ… **Layouts** â€” All designed using XML and ConstraintLayout
âœ… **Lottie Animations** â€” For cute pet movements
âœ… **Safe Args** â€” Navigation with arguments (shopping > pet)
âœ… **WorkManager** â€” For background tasks (optional)
âœ… **Offline Triggers** â€” Stored in JSON for replies like this one
